focus_skills: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
Inference from sample statistics and margin of error

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='20' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='10' y='145' font-size='12'>Q</text><text x='10' y='10' font-size='12'>P</text><text x='185' y='145' font-size='12'>R</text><text x='90' y='145' font-size='12'>15</text><text x='5' y='75' font-size='12'>8</text><text x='100' y='70' font-size='12'>17</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle PQR with right angle at Q, side PQ = 8, side QR = 15, hypotenuse PR = 17
questions.question: In the right triangle shown, what is the value of <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: The sine of angle P is the ratio of the length of the side opposite angle P to the length of the hypotenuse. The side opposite angle P is QR = 15, and the hypotenuse is PR = 17. Therefore, <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>15</mn><mn>17</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember that sine is opposite over hypotenuse in a right triangle.

questions.question: A right triangle has legs of lengths 9 units and 12 units. What is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.explanation: By the Pythagorean theorem, the hypotenuse <math><mi>c</mi></math> satisfies <math><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>9</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>12</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>81</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>144</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>225</mn></math>. Thus, <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>225</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Apply the Pythagorean theorem directly for hypotenuse calculations in right triangles.

questions.question: If <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>23</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Add 5 to both sides: <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>28</mn></math>. Divide by 4: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Isolate the variable by performing inverse operations step by step.

questions.question: An item costs $80 after a 20% discount. What was the original price?
questions.explanation: Let the original price be <math><mi>p</mi></math>. Then <math><mn>0.8</mn><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn></math>, so <math><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>0.8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For discount problems, set up the equation using the percentage remaining.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='20' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='10' y='145' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='10' y='10' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='185' y='145' font-size='12'>C</text><text x='90' y='145' font-size='12'>12</text><text x='100' y='70' font-size='12'>13</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle ABC with right angle at A, side AC = 12, hypotenuse BC = 13
questions.question: In the right triangle shown, which of the following has the same value as <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Angles B and C are complementary, so <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Recall that sine and cosine of complementary angles are equal.

questions.question: Triangle DEF is similar to triangle GHI, with angle D corresponding to angle G, and both having right angles at E and H. If <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>13</mn></mfrac></math>, what is <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>G</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Corresponding angles in similar triangles are equal, so <math><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>G</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>13</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In similar triangles, trigonometric ratios for corresponding angles are equal.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math> can be rewritten as which of the following?
questions.explanation: Factoring the quadratic: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To factor quadratics, find two numbers that multiply to the constant term and add to the linear coefficient.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: If 3 pounds of apples cost $4.50, how much do 5 pounds cost?
questions.explanation: The rate is $1.50 per pound. For 5 pounds: 5 × 1.50 = 7.50.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Set up proportions for rate problems.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question: What is the solution to the system: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Adding the equations: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>, so <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use addition or substitution to solve systems of linear equations.

questions.question: In a right triangle, the sum of the acute angles is 90 degrees, and <math><mi>tan</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. What is <math><mi>tan</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Since A and B are complementary, <math><mi>tan</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cot</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use cofunction identities for complementary angles in right triangles.

questions.question: In right triangle JKL, angle K is right, angle J is 30 degrees, JK = 10. What is the perimeter?
questions.explanation: In a 30-60-90 triangle with the adjacent side to the 30° angle being 10, the opposite side is <math><mn>10</mn><mo>/</mo><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></math> and the hypotenuse is <math><mn>20</mn><mo>/</mo><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></math>. The perimeter is <math><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>/</mo><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mo>+</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>/</mo><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize special right triangle ratios for efficient solving.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='300' height='300' viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='300' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='20' x2='180' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='10' y='145' font-size='12'>M</text><text x='10' y='10' font-size='12'>N</text><text x='185' y='145' font-size='12'>O</text><text x='90' y='145' font-size='12'>a</text><text x='100' y='70' font-size='12'>b</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle MNO with right angle at M, side MO = a, hypotenuse NO = b
questions.question: If <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>, what is the perimeter in terms of a?
questions.explanation: <math><mi>sin</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>N</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math>, so <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>a</mi></math>. The adjacent side is <math><msqrt><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>a</mi></math>. The perimeter is <math><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Express all sides in terms of one variable using trig ratios and Pythagorean theorem.

questions.question: Simplify <math><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. What is the result?
questions.explanation: Factor numerator: <math><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Factor and cancel common terms in rational expressions.

questions.question: The perimeter of an isosceles right triangle is <math><mn>24</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>. What is the hypotenuse length?
questions.explanation: Let leg be <math><mi>l</mi></math>. Hypotenuse <math><mi>l</mi><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>. Perimeter <math><mn>2</mn><mi>l</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>l</mi><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>24</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>. Solve for <math><mi>l</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Hypotenuse <math><mn>12</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For isosceles right triangles, use the side ratio 1:1:<math><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></math>.

questions.skill: Inference from sample statistics and margin of error
questions.question: A survey of 400 people has a margin of error of ±4%. If 52% favor a policy, which is true?

options.B: The true proportion is between 48% and 56%
options.C: The sample size is too small
options.D: The margin of error is too large

questions.explanation: The confidence interval is 52% ±4%, so 48% to 56%.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Understand margin of error as defining the range around the sample statistic.

questions.question: Solve for <math><mi>x</mi></math> in <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. What is the product of solutions for <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></math>: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. Expand: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>, <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>, <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>24</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Product of roots = -12.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For quadratic systems, use substitution and quadratic formula properties.

questions.question: A circle has equation <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. What is the radius?
questions.explanation: Standard form <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>h</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, so <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Identify the square of the radius in the circle equation.

questions.question: Which values of <math><mi>x</mi></math> satisfy <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>></mo><mn>5</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mn>10</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: First: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Second: <math><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. Intersection: <math><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Solve each inequality separately and find the intersection.

questions.question: A cylinder has radius 5 and height 8. What is its volume?
questions.explanation: Volume = <math><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn><mi>π</mi></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Recall volume formulas for common 3D shapes.

questions.question: In a group of 50 people, 30 like tea, 25 like coffee, 10 like both. What is the probability that a random person likes tea or coffee?
questions.explanation: P(tea or coffee) = P(tea) + P(coffee) - P(both) = 30/50 + 25/50 - 10/50 = 45/50.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the inclusion-exclusion principle for union probabilities.
